**The *Inner Essentials of the Mysterious Eight Gates of Lord Deng Tianjun* (Sutra Title: *Inner Essentials of the Mysterious Eight Gates of Lord Deng Tianjun*)**
Attributed to an unknown author. One scroll.
Source: *The Orthodox Daoist Canon* (正统道藏), First Canon (正一部).

**Lord Deng Tianjun’s Inner Essentials of the Mysterious Eight Gates**
The Celestial Lord (天君) personally inscribed these Essentials of the Mysterious Eight Gates and the Secret Formula of the Sixty *Jiazi* (甲子) on the Palm.

Its essence is the formula for the Nine Palaces (九宫) and the Eight Gates (八门) to determine daily retributions (直日報應). The method of judgment differs from the *Eight Gates Drum Song* (打門槌歌) of the Divine Old Master Xu (徐神翁) and the *Ghost’s Knocks at the Gate* (鬼敲門) method; it is not based on candle divination (占灯) or ritual readings (占课).

Those who obtain this formula should not cling rigidly to its sequence but recite and memorize it well. Its auspicious or inauspicious meanings will be revealed by the Dao’s divine guidance (神告), infallible in every trial.

**First, refine the Two Attendants (二使) within the Dipper (斗).**
Then, draw the true forms of the Two Attendants and venerate them at dawn and dusk (晨夕寅奉).

**The Double-Flying Seven-Star Constraints (双飞七星罡):**
Exhale (吹) and inhale (呵) the *Kan* (坎) and *Li* (離) energies in union.
**The Infant and Maiden Formation (婴儿姹女结):**
The Two Attendants bathe in the *Hua Pool* (華池).

**Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth (金木水火土):**
Know their comings and goings, their births and deaths (去來知生死).
**Seize the Four Celestial Gates (四天門),**
No need to verify their efficacy (不問驗不驗).
**The Dipper’s Inner Vision (斗中内景):**
Silently recite the *Long Life Formula* (長生).

**The Secret Formula for Judging Auspiciousness in Poetry**
*"For mortals with ailments, examine their roots (勘其因),*
Silently recite the Eight Gates and Four Principles (四理) to reveal their truth (真).
*This oral transmission of the Long Life Formula (長生诀) requires no external means to seek its truth (不须物外更求真)."*

**The Auspicious Eight Gates Formula for Direct Daily Retribution (陽日八門默點直日報應詩)**
*"If the Gate of Auspiciousness (休門) is encountered, dig the soil (掘土) promptly,*
*Then early determine the causes of joy and sorrow (悲喜定元因).*
*Even Bian Que (扁鹊) himself may judge it as death,*
*But Master Xu’s words alone reveal its true essence (親授真)."*

**The Inauspicious Eight Gates Formula for Direct Daily Retribution (陰日八門默點直日報應詩)**
*"If the Gate of Alarm (驚門) appears, first cross the inquiry (過詢),*
*Danger looms for three days—its cause is fixed (定元因).*
*Beyond this, if the Gate of Auspiciousness (景門) is passed, Master Xu will safeguard (徐公保),*
*Yet neither Lu Yi (卢医) nor Bian Que (扁鹊) can cross its true boundary (不度真)."*

**The *Jiazi* (甲子) Formula for Auspiciousness (跏趺口诀)**
*"Sit in the morning, stand in the evening, and sit again at midnight (子).*
**Double-Flying Seven-Star Constraints (双飞七星罡):**
Exhale (吹) and inhale (呵) the *Kan* (坎) and *Li* (離) energies in union.
**The Infant and Maiden Formation (婴儿姹女结):**
The Seven Stars (七星) bathe in the *Hua Pool* (華池) for seventy-seven days.

*Open the gates in the seventh and eighth months (七月、八月).*
*Auspiciousness governs the ninth and tenth months (休九月、十月).*
*Life thrives in the eleventh month (生十一月).*
*Alarm dominates the fifth and sixth months (驚五月、六月居中).*
*Decay belongs to the twelfth month (傷十二月).*
*Death is fixed in the third month’s *Chen* (辰) and fourth month’s *Si* (巳) (死三月辰、四月巳).*
*The Gate of Auspiciousness (景門) passes through the second month’s *Mao* (卯).*
*Du (杜) governs the first month’s *Yin* (寅)."*

**The Right Eight Gates Formula for Determining Auspiciousness by Month (逐月所值以取吉凶例)**
*"The monthly correspondences are taken thus for auspicious or inauspicious signs:*
*In the first month, reverse the Du (杜) gate to ascend (上行).*
*The Gate of Auspiciousness (景門) passes through the second month’s decan (旬).*
*Chen (辰) and Si (巳) cross the fourth month’s node (節).*
*The Gate of Alarm (驚門) passes through the sixth month’s midpoint (中).*
*The Gate of Opening (開門) determines joy in the seventh month (七月喜),*
*Memorize firmly: Auspiciousness ascends in the ninth month (九十牢記休上行).*
*The Gate of Life (生門) again brings joy when the *Zi* (子) month appears (子月現).*
*The Gate of Decay (傷門) determines the master’s fate in the passing year (過残年)."*

**The Ritual Process**
The master enters a state of tranquility (靖), reciting the *Pure Mouth Incantation* (念净口咒), the *Pure Heart Incantation* (净心咒), the *Pure Body Incantation* (净身咒), and the *Pure Heaven and Earth Incantation* (净天地咒). After refining impurities (炼秽), the *qi* is retained within (存内), the *Yan Sheng Scripture* (延生经) is recited in transformation (变诵), and the master sits in *Dali* (跏趺) posture, striking teeth twenty-four times (叩齿二十四通), and harmonizing breath (交气).

*"Greed for vast wealth (贪巨禄) and corruption in virtue (文廉武破) [are judged],*
*[Blank] [Blank] [Blank] [Blank] [Blank] [Blank] [Blank]."*

**The Dipper (斗) Ritual**
Each participant (讳各交) recites seven times (七遍), swallowing saliva nine times (咽液九过), retaining the *qi* within oneself as the True Person of one’s natal command (本命真人状).

**The Master’s Silent Incantation (師默诵咒曰):**
*"The Left Azure Dragon (左青龙), Master Meng (孟章), swiftly emerges from my left,*
*Exhale the liver *qi* (嘘肝气) once into the left side.*
*The Right White Tiger (右白虎), Marshal Jing (监兵), swiftly emerges from my right,*
*Inhale the lung *qi* (咽肺气) once into the right side.*
*The Front Vermilion Bird (前朱雀), Spirit Guang (灵光), swiftly emerges before me,*
*Exhale the heart *qi* (呵心气) before me.*
*The Rear Dark Tortoise (后玄武), Bearer of Brilliance (执明), swiftly emerges behind me,*
*Inhale the kidney *qi* (吹肾气) behind me.*
*Imagine the Four Beasts (四兽) guarding the exhalation-inhalation method (护呵法),*
*Retain the *qi* within the body, blowing it into both eyes (身吹存两目),*
*Then manifest the light of sun and moon (日月之光),*
*Called the *Division of Sun and Moon Light* (日月分光).*
*Next, store the *qi* in the left and right nostrils, inhaling it into the heart,*
*Forming the True Person (真人) within the Vermilion Palace (绛宫)."*

**Then recite the Heart Incantation (却念心咒):**
*"Heart’s divine spirit (心中神),*
*Lord Dan Yuan (丹元君),*
*Named Huang Ting (黄庭),*
*Called Hua Yin (字华婴),*
*Two inches in length (长二寸),*
*Three *fen* in breadth (广三分),*
*Wearing crimson robes (着朱衣),*
*With vermilion sash (系绛裙),*
*Wielding awe-inspiring virtue (秉威德),*
*Manifesting sacred brilliance (显圣灵),*
*Penetrating creation (通造化),*
*Reaching ultimate truth (达至真),*
*Dwelling in the heart (住心中),*
*Never leaving the body (莫离身),*
*In all affairs, swiftly reporting to mortals (凡有事，速报人).*
*Urgent, as the precepts decree (急急如律令)."*

**The Heart’s Path in the Dipper (心步斗),**
*Entering to serve the Cloud Chariot Talisman (入内服云车符),*
*Oral transmission and heart transmission (口授心传) alone suffice (方能尽矣).*

**"The Thousand-Gold Secret—Oath and Transmission"**

*Never reveal this treasure—*
*Memorize the sworn vow.*
*When the Cloud Chariot suddenly arrives,*
*Store the reverent Fire Officials and attendants—*
*The qi of the five viscera condensed within.*
*Next, ascend the Cloud Chariot,*
*With the beloved attendants and certain generals following,*
*The Four Rectifiers riding in procession,*
*Passing through the Yellow Path’s climatic zones.*
*Rise as if scaling the void,*
*Drawing upon the *wāifēng* qi—*
*The membrane.*
*If the wind turns grim and uncrossable,*
*Suddenly the reverent Fire appears—*
*The *dǎnshén* (bodiless spirit).*
*Fan aside the *wāifēng*,*
*The Yellow Path now clear.*
*Suddenly, the Rainbow Bridge approaches—*
*The generals emerge from the Cloud Chariot,*
*With the reverent Fire and Four Rectifiers,*
*Crossing into the Hall of Audience.*
*The Four Rectifiers present Yang Yan and Geng Bi,*
*Who lead me into the *Xuánjī* Bureau,*
*To pay homage and report.*
*Afterward, with the Four Rectifiers and the *dǎnshén*,*
*We exit the Hall,*
*Observing any omens returned.*
*If no response comes to the petitions,*
*Retire into the *Jìng* Chamber,*
*Wait for verification,*
*Then return with the beloved attendants, the *dǎnshén*,*
*And the Four Rectifiers,*
*Descend the Bridge, board the Cloud Chariot,*
*Pass through the Yellow Path’s *gāngfēng* winds,*
*Arrive at the Vermilion Palace,*
*Disembark, and reintegrate the attendants into the body.*
*Swallow saliva, strike the teeth,*
*Then proceed according to the prescribed method,*
*Returning each to its proper domain.*
*Suddenly, the form vanishes—*
*The *Nine Palaces, Eight Gates* Omen Chart.*

**Sun Shock, Moon Rest:**
*When *jiǎzǐ* (the first heavenly stem-branch) arrives at the Central Palace,*
*It is the *Kūn* Earth Gate.*
*The remaining sixty *jiǎzǐ* follow in cycles.*
*The Yellow Nine Palaces:*
*Each day governs one position,*
*Cycling endlessly.*
*On days matching the native *yin* day,*
*Rest on *yang* days—*
*The preceding position opens the Palace.*
*According to the Nine Palaces’ *jiǎzǐ*,*
*From *yǐ* to *dīng*, the evasions rise—*
*Most verified.*
*This must remain supremely secret.*
*If later disciples receive this,*
*Never reveal it lightly—*
*Disaster will fall upon the Nine Ancestors,*
*The Bridge, and your wife’s lineage.*

---

**The Longevity Wheel and Dipper Rotation:**

*If born on *jiǎzǐ*,*
*Metal’s *chángshēng* reaches *wèi*.*
*Thus begins the pattern—*
*Child is *Pòjūn* (the Broken Army),*
*Single-marching to its native month,*
*Then retreating—*
*Determining auspicious or inauspicious months.*
*Count *chángshēng* to the fetal stage,*
*Then add *xiū*, *yōu*, *sǐ*, and *jué*—*
*Predicting misfortune for the ill,*
*Which month they reside in,*
*To know life, death, and fortune.*
*Again, take the hour—*
*For example, *wǔ* (Fire)—*
*Fire’s *chángshēng* reaches *yín*.*
*As before,*
*Count forward to determine the direct influence,*
*Add the native day,*
*Then cross-check which day aligns with the native *wǔ*—*
*Thus, life, death, and fortune are known.*

*Oral transmission exhausts here—*
*Only the enlightened can comprehend.*

---

**The Monthly Dipper Rotation Pattern:**

*First month: *yín* (Tiger),*
*Second: *mǎo* (Rabbit),*
*Third: *chén* (Dragon),*
*Fourth: *sì* (Snake),*
*Fifth: *wǔ* (Horse),*
*Sixth: *wèi* (Sheep),*
*Seventh: *shēn* (Monkey),*
*Eighth: *yǒu* (Rooster),*
*Ninth: *xū* (Dog),*
*Tenth: *hài* (Pig),*
*Eleventh: *zǐ* (Rat),*
*Twelfth: *chǒu* (Ox).*

**The Direct Lamp of Omen Wheels:**
*Metal’s *chángshēng* reaches *wèi*,*
*Wood’s to *hài*,*
*Water and Earth’s *chángshēng* dwell in *shēn*,*
*Fire’s to *yín*.*
*According to the Dipper’s domain,*
*The zodiac’s pattern is as written above.*
*Count *chángshēng*, *mùyù*, *guàn dài*, *lín guān*, *dì wàng*,*
*Rest, imprisonment, death, and absolute void,*
*Then add *xiū*, *yōu*, *sǐ*, *jué*—*
*For the afflicted, which month they were born,*
*To know fortune or misfortune.*

*Tested a thousand times—*
*Thousandfold verified,*
*The master’s transmission never errs,*
*Only the disciple’s blame.*
*The gods will not respond.*

*Knock, knock—*
*Never lightly divulge these mysteries.*

---

**The Eight Gates Divination Method:**
*Master Xu’s transmission to Lord Ouyang,*
*Called *Dǎménchuí* (Striking the Gate),*
*Also *Guǐ Qiǎo Mén* (Ghost Knocking at the Gate).*

*To seek fortune or disaster,*
*Or question safety,*
*First examine the Eight Gates closely—*
*Whatever is seen or heard in one position,*
*Is the ghostly spirit’s report.*
*Next, observe how it responds—*
*The intervening omens of rest or calamity.*
*If laughter and joy are heard,*
*Fortune is known.*
*If sorrowful voices arise,*
*Disaster follows.*
*If axes, hoes, or blades appear,*
*The questioner will hear weeping.*
*If a child is carried in,*
*Consult the *yīnyáng* carefully.*
*Men holding *yīn* will soon marry,*
*Women pregnant will bear a child.*
*Men carrying men,*
*Quarrels will erupt soon.*
*Women carrying snakes,*
*Adultery and scandal will follow.*
*If lawsuits involve loose robes,*
*No matter the loss, the case will resolve.*
*If a cane is carried,*
*The sick will die without medicine.*
*If silk or hemp passes by,*
*Mourning garments will appear—*
*The deceased is near.*
*Weigh the light and heavy,*
*And speak accordingly.*
*If the family’s ghosts torment,*
*Examine the corpse’s form—*
*The visitor’s shape will reveal it.*
*If selling fish or crows is seen,*
*Long-awaited news will arrive.*
*If the Mei family’s matchmaker moves,*
*The Li household will suffer loss.*
*If blood relatives separate,*
*The Tao family will flee.*
*If peaches are seen,*
*Someone will depart.*
*If dogs bark from the direction,*
*The household will mourn.*
*If rats pass with a sound,*
*Wealth will scatter, and thieves will prey.*
*If ink is spilled,*
*Fields will be ruined,*
*Broken vessels foretell misfortune.*
*If lamps flicker,*
*The household will be startled,*
*Unsettled.*
*If a spider descends,*
*The family will rejoice.*
*On *yang* days in the *Zhèn* position,*
*Boys are born.*
*On *yin* days in the *xiǎo fáng*,*
*Girls arrive.*
*When horses neigh,*
*The Five Bandits rage.*
*If cats mew,*
*Debts and grievances will follow.*
*If cats bite the feet,*
*The *Tánshén* (Incense Spirit) brings calamity—*
*Offerings must be made.*
*Flowers blooming or wilting,*
*Fortune or misfortune—*
*If blooming, do not rejoice prematurely.*
*Oxen, sheep, or dogs are never auspicious,*
*Curses, roosters crowing, or the *Zhūquè* (Vermilion Bird) cries.*
*If bells ring from either side,*
*If asking about childbirth,*
*A girl will be born.*

「能参造化真机妙，
能 grasp the profound and subtle principles of *造化* (the cosmic creation and transformation);

一法通时万法精，
one method perfected at the right time renders all methods precise.

依此推详断祸福，
By this means, one may deduce fortune and misfortune;

名传天下任纵横。」
its fame will spread across the land, allowing one to act with boundless freedom.

「内应本命灯下略占，
Within the scope of one’s native destiny, a brief divination may be made beneath the lamp:

验其五色：
examining the five colors:

青冤、黄时气、赤三日安、红吉、一。」
blue—grievances, yellow—*时气* (auspicious timing), red—three-day tranquility, crimson—auspiciousness, and void.

「七三朝死
On the seventh or third day of death,

徐神翁鬼敲门
the *徐神翁* (Xu Shenwang) spirit haunts, knocking at the door—

劳吊、庙缢、落水、石泥精樟、古墓、伏、井、鳌、客、星辰、睨诅、地、血、土、刀、吻、魅、家亲。」
mourning, hanging in a temple, drowning, spirits from stone pits or ancient graves, buried alive, wells, tortoises, guests, celestial omens, curses, bloodstains, soil, knives, bites, enchantments, and relatives.

若依此验法，
If one follows this divination method,

照破诸鬼神。」
one may pierce through all specters and deities.

「二十四字经歌判状
The Twenty-Four Character *经歌* (Divinatory Song) determines fate:

天生地死，
Heaven births, Earth dies;

地死天生。
Earth dies, Heaven births.

灾生危死，
Calamity births, peril dies;

危死灾生。」
peril dies, calamity births.

「乾坎艮震巽离坤兑，
*乾* (Heaven), *坎* (Abyss), *艮* (Mountain), *震* (Thunder), *巽* (Wind), *离* (Fire), *坤* (Earth), and *兑* (Joy).

状若无头是祖宗，
If the pattern lacks a head, it signifies ancestors;

於中点污是亲朋。」
while stains within denote kin and friends.

「字画散乱邻伴鬼，
Scattered strokes and chaotic patterns portend neighboring spectral companions;

卜字画像木石精。」
divinatory characters resembling wooden or stone spirits.

「笔头锁出遭刑死，
A sealed pen stroke foretells execution;

错乱行斜杀伤魂。」
erratic or slanted lines denote fatal blows to the spirit.

「乾枯无力难医救，
*乾* (Heaven) lines withered and powerless—difficult to heal or cure;

勾挑动土犯家神。」
hooks or strokes disturbing the earth offend household deities.

「字有圈涂心分动，
A circled or marked character disturbs the mind;

行祸命蹇定难存。」
while ill-fated lines confirm stagnation and survival is uncertain.

「纸破便言宿欠债，
If the paper tears, it speaks of past debts;

补贴定是此中倾。」
while mending or patching confirms impending ruin.

「添注引入无常鬼，
Adding notes or annotations invites the *无常鬼* (spirits of impermanence);

油污投河落水人。」
ink stains or grease that resemble casting into a river portend drowning.

「改抹前生有冤债，
Erasing or altering strokes signify past grievances or debts;

切须家内细推寻。」
one must carefully examine within the household.

「或浓或淡主赢弱，
Whether thick or faint, the lines indicate weakness;

皆是点污伏尸停。」
all are stains hinting at buried corpses.

「横顺草飞组破鬼，
Horizontal or vertical strokes, stray brushstrokes, or scattered clusters betray spirits;

妄意押字不尊神。」
while reckless sealing of characters disrespects deities.

「大小切疑由进退，
Size discrepancies must be scrutinized by advancement or retreat;

寒热往来病愈深。」
as cold and heat alternate, the illness deepens.

「要知男女何方病，
To discern where illness afflicts males or females:

阳只阴双行内寻。」
seek single strokes for *yang* (male) and paired for *yin* (female).

「咬牙定是家先鬼，
Gnashing of teeth confirms ancestral spirits;

自言自语是姻亲。」
while muttering to oneself indicates marital kin.

「来谎语是主重病，
If falsehoods are spoken, the master suffers grave illness;

来者人欢是病轻。」
while joyous visitors signify light affliction.

「此是徐翁真口诀，
This is the true *口诀* (oral formula) of Xu Shenwang,

能交世俗善通神。」
capable of harmonizing with mortals and effectively communicating with deities.

「学取自知如至宝，
To learn and master this is akin to discovering a supreme treasure;

千金莫泄与非人。」
do not reveal it for a thousand gold—never to the unworthy.

「留传末后参详到，
Pass it down to future generations for careful study;

管取虚无一寸金。」
for even an inch of gold is worthless compared to its wisdom.

「又名煞
Also known as *煞* (ill-fated days):

年逢生煞日凶亡，
If one’s birth year encounters an ill-fated day, disaster or death befalls;

一死一生也难当。」
even one death or one life may not suffice to endure its consequences.

「若遇吉时并凶日，
If auspicious times coincide with ill-fated days,

也须奏告保安康。」
one must still perform rites to ensure safety and longevity.

「坤生、兑、死乾、离危、起吉坎、巽安、震、凶艮。」
*坤* (Earth) births, *兑* (Joy) births, *乾* (Heaven) dies, *离* (Fire) is perilous, *坎* (Abyss) is auspicious, *巽* (Wind) brings tranquility, *震* (Thunder) is ill-fated, and *艮* (Mountain) is ill-fated.

「论是何生得几岁，
To calculate how many years one will live based on their birth:

却从坎上起数一十，
begin counting from *坎* (Abyss) upward by ten;

艮上二十，
from *艮* (Mountain) upward by twenty—

零数节节数去，
discarding remainders at each step,

直何年上遁月，
until reaching the year of escape by month,

月上遁日，
by day within the month,

日上遁时，
by hour within the day,

直何吉凶，
to determine the ultimate auspiciousness or ill-fate.

以验祸福。」
This verifies fortune or misfortune.

「论一年月分，
To calculate for a single year and month:

却将正月从艮上，
begin with the first month from *艮* (Mountain);

二月震，
the second month from *震* (Thunder);

三月、四月巽，
the third and fourth months from *巽* (Wind);

五月、六月离，
the fifth and sixth months from *离* (Fire);

七月、八月坤，
the seventh and eighth months from *坤* (Earth);

九月、十月兑，
the ninth and tenth months from *兑* (Joy);

十一月乾，
the eleventh month from *乾* (Heaven);

十二月坎。」
the twelfth month from *坎* (Abyss).

「若论日子吉凶，
If one calculates the auspiciousness or ill-fate of days:

从乾上起子，
begin with *乾* (Heaven) for the day’s stem,

顺行节节数去，
counting sequentially through the branches,

以诀吉凶。」
to determine their auspiciousness or ill-fate.

「八门硬例
The *八门* (Eight Doors) fixed rules:

假如，甲子日属阳顺，
For instance, if the *甲子* (first day of the sexagenary cycle) belongs to *阳顺* (auspicious *yang*),

从乾上起杜、景、死、惊、开、休、生、伤。」
count from *乾* (Heaven) as follows: *杜* (blocked), *景* (bright), *死* (death), *惊* (fright), *开* (open), *休* (rest), *生* (life), and *伤* (injury).

「假如乙丑日属阴，
If the *乙丑* (second day) belongs to *阴* (yin),

逆行从艮上起杜、景、死、惊、开、休、生、伤。」
count in reverse from *艮* (Mountain): *杜* (blocked), *景* (bright), *死* (death), *惊* (fright), *开* (open), *休* (rest), *生* (life), and *伤* (injury).

余仿此，
The rest follow similarly,

年月日时，
for years, months, days, and hours,

皆论阴阳日建立八门俱仿此例。」
each must be calculated according to *yin-yang* and the day’s stem, following this rule.

「报应吉凶，
The consequences of auspiciousness or ill-fate

在於七内。」
lie within the *七内* (seven internal factors).

「家人立杜还天愿，
If household members set up *杜* (blocked), it fulfills Heaven’s wishes;

外人到杜遭天谴。」
while outsiders encountering *杜* face Heaven’s punishment.

「猫至冤牵天愿催，
If cats arrive, they hasten grievances tied to Heaven’s wishes;

叫凶静吉可禳转。」
while their cries indicate ill-fate, which may be averted by tranquility and auspiciousness.

「大来咒诅灵泽坛，
If great curses or invocations come,

吠主哭声三七见。」
the master’s barking or weeping will appear on the third or seventh day.

「景户兄声人财离，
If *景* (bright) coincides with a brother’s voice,

猫叫冤愆白虎随。」
while a cat’s cry indicates grievances, with the *白虎* (White Tiger) following.

「三七之中主哭泣，
On the third or seventh day, the master weeps;

屋漏之时讼解归。」
while leaks in the house during litigation bring resolution.

「蛛子垂丝应落地，
If a spider descends its thread to the ground,

婚姻喜事两相宜。」
it signifies auspiciousness for both marriage and joyous affairs.

「死户猫声病主亡，
If *死* (death) coincides with a cat’s cry,

犬来逐鼠病狼当。」
while dogs chasing mice indicate that the master’s illness will be as dire as a wolf’s.

「响应之时灯寿灭，
If the *响应* (echo) coincides with the time,

灯寿灭。」
the lamp’s lifespan will be extinguished.

「三朝一七主离床，
On the third day or seventh day of an illness,

儿童叫时悲哭动，
if children cry out in sorrow,

此方宜静且审详。」
this situation demands calm and careful scrutiny.

「惊户外人喧主殃，
If *惊* (fright) coincides with outsiders’ noise,

猫犬高声且见凶。」
while cats or dogs barking loudly indicate ill-fate.

「孕妇定然主惊恐，
If a pregnant woman is alarmed,

器破之时大不同。」
while broken vessels at that time signify great differences.

「开烛猫犬大吉祥，
If *开* (open) coincides with cats or dogs,

鼠静财凶后主昌。」
while mice being tranquil indicate that financial ill-fate will later bring prosperity.

「风雨病迟讼即解，
If wind or rain coincide with delayed illness,

蛛子垂丝百事昌。」
while spiders descending their threads signify auspiciousness for all matters.

「休门屋漏主更移，
If *休* (rest) coincides with a leaky house,

讼中得理病人奇。」
while litigants gain justice, the sick person faces extraordinary circumstances.

「二物叫时醮谢吉，
If two creatures cry out during a *醮* (exorcism) ritual,

风中司命亦相欺。」
while the *司命* (Deity of Life) in the wind may also deceive.

「蛛子垂丝内外喜，
If spiders descend their threads,

看看有梦吋熊熊。」
one must observe carefully, as auspicious dreams will blaze forth.

「生门垂蛛孕生女，
If *生* (life) coincides with spiders descending,

一米阳产两成坤。」
one *米* (measure) of *yang* (male) production will yield two *坤* (female) results.

「猫犬去时凶得吉，
If cats or dogs depart at an ill-fated time,

家先司命保元亨。」
while ancestral *司命* (Deities of Life) safeguard the primal prosperity.

「伤门猫犬去时吉，
If *伤* (injury) coincides with cats or dogs departing,

高座喧争大不然。」
while high seats bring noisy disputes, which are most inauspicious.

「外客高声猖鬼乱，
If outsiders speak loudly,

啾嘈鼠子主喧争。」
while mice chattering indicate the master will face disputes.

「自己察情兆
One must examine personal omens:

闲坐最为吉，
sitting leisurely is most auspicious;

高枕主留连。」
while reclining with a high pillow indicates lingering attachment.

「切忌持刀斧，
One must strictly avoid holding axes or knives;

锄铺主穷年。」
while hoeing or plowing portends a year of poverty.

「自己有呻吟，
If one groans or moans to oneself,

安能保别人。」
how can one protect others?

「手弹时气病，
If one plays with *时气* (auspicious timing) by hand,

争斗一朝临。」
litigation or conflict will soon arise.

「看经却主吉，
If one reads scriptures,

病愈在一七。」
illness will recover on the seventh day.

「治事终迟滞，
If one delays in attending to matters,

终须宽裹急。」
one must eventually broaden and then narrow the approach.

「恰直起时病，
If illness arises at the exact moment of uprightness,

安在三两日。」
it will not last beyond three days.

「若直欢娱时，
If illness arises during a time of joy and merriment,

病者愈为奇。」
the sick person’s recovery will be miraculous.

「若直忧立时，
If illness arises during a time of sorrow and distress,

病者见倾危。」
the sick person faces imminent peril.

「若言吉财吉，
If one speaks of auspicious fortune,

若言凶则凶。」
while if one speaks of ill-fate, ill-fate will prevail.

「来人气象好，
If visitors appear with a favorable *气象* (aura),

祸福不相同。」
fortune and misfortune will not be the same.

「我身无事阻，
If my own body faces no obstruction,

即往运亨通。」
then all endeavors will proceed smoothly and auspiciously.

「The hunched back and staff arrive—
the sick will die without need for medicine.

A raincoat and straw hat come to greet—
the mourning garments loom, pressing with urgency.

When parasols summon me back and forth,
the seven-day mourning may be granted leniency.

If the person wears coarse hemp,
the mourning attire is prepared in due course.

A headcloth and cap strengthen the body—
the sick will soon regain health.

At this time, if one tastes food or drink,
wealth and horses will not be severed.

If one drinks early spring tea,
its refreshing coolness proves most beneficial.

If one consumes all manner of fruits,
boils and abscesses will worsen daily.

If the epidemic does not harm,
chronic illness resists medicine’s calming.

On the road, if no obstacles are met,
the aged will return with the vigor of youth.

If one encounters others’ entreaties first,
the illness lingers, delayed in its answer.

When I return home with uprightness,
stars and constellations emerge from the clouds.

If I speak with others in anger,
the sick will face *迍否* (obstruction and misfortune).

When called during times of joy and celebration,
morning sickness vanishes by nightfall.

After clear skies in spring or winter,
the *晦滞* (obscured and stagnant) will multiply with rain.

After clear skies in summer or autumn,
no medicine is needed—the illness will heal.

When called, observe their demeanor—
cleverness lies in the mind’s keen insight.

Another method for predicting one’s return:
Do not rely solely on the time—use the mouth as reference.

For instance, if *子时* (midnight) is given,
*子* belongs to Water—Water and Earth flourish at midnight.

Using this as precedent,
compare it to the *长生斗* (Celestial Longevity Measure),
and proceed through each node in rotation.

If one meets *子* (Water) in its ascendancy,
it is indeed flourishing.

The person will surely return on *子丑* (midnight to 1–3 AM) days.
If *养* (Nourishing) is encountered, they will return as well.

The rest follow this pattern analogously.

Fear not the black wind or towering waves—
the ship’s journey depends entirely on the helmsman’s skill.

*—Chao Yuan An* (□) *—(□) Om—*

Tread the iron shoes until no trace remains,
yet seek not—it comes effortlessly.
*—Hūm—* Leaf and branch unite.»

**Secret Appendix:**

Above the kidneys, below the heart—
to the west of the liver, to the left of the lungs—
this is the **Divine Brightness Acupoint**,
within which lie the **Kàn-Lí Palaces** [1].

With the tongue’s tip, inscribe:
*"Óng"*—when the character moves, *"Hūm"*—
emerging from the **Kàn and Lí hexagrams**.

The Dragon issues forth from fire’s embrace,
the Tiger is born within the water’s depths.

The **Nine Palaces, Eight Gates** elusion method
must be mastered through the sixty **Tiān-Gān-Dì-Zǐ** [2] cycles.

Inscribe the talisman:
Left at **Heaven’s Pass (Tiān Guān)**,
right at **Earth’s Axis (Dì Zhóu)**,
preserving the self as the **Mysterious Sovereign**,
with the tortoise and serpent standing above.

With the **orifices** drawing in water and fire into the talisman,
take the **iron armor’s silver radiance** into it,
then draw in the **gallbladder’s essence**,
mixing with *"Zhuàng"* and *"Óng"*—
depending on the method, issue forth.

The **Mysterious Soul’s Eight Gates** secret—
rarely revealed, worth a thousand gold—
do not divulge.

Practice long, and one may **enter the Dao**;
employ it long, and one may **communicate with spirits**.

Most secret, most secret—
revere this method.

Revealing it to the unworthy
brings calamity to the nine ancestral lines,
a grave misfortune—
be exceedingly cautious.

Blood-slave, flesh-slave, you are the **compassionate true parents**.

The **Tiān Péng Curse** forms the **Wēn Shuài’s** original self-symbol.
The talisman invokes the **Earthly Deities’ Marshal Wēn**,
conjuring the **Six Tiān-Gān Generals**—**Nǐ Dān Sòng**—
commanding the **Supervising Officials of Fate and Land Spirits**,
to safeguard the child,
whereby the affliction of **nightly crying** shall cease—
the talisman’s arrival shall swiftly resolve it.
Upon its arrival, execute as commanded.

**Subject** [name redacted], having received the **Imperial Edict**,
shall carry out this decree.

*—By the decree of the **Heavenly Lord of Mysterious Soul’s Eight Gates Retribution**—*
**Final.**

chunks.original_text: 邓天君玄灵八门报应内旨 经名：邓天君玄灵八门报应内旨。 撰人不详。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 邓天君玄灵八门报应内旨 天君降笔，亲书玄灵八门内旨、掌上六十甲子秘诀。 其旨，乃九宫遁用八门直日报应之诀，断例自与徐神翁打门槌歌诀，鬼敲门之法相同，亦不在占灯占课。 得此诀者，毋抱执泥次，宜习诵熟记，其吉凶自有神告之妙，万试万灵。 先炼斗中二使，更画二使真像，晨夕寅奉。 双飞七星罡，吹呵媾坎离。 婴儿姹女结，二使浴华池。 金木水火土，去来知生死。 把断四天门，不问验不验。 斗中内景，默点长生。 口诀断诗 世人有病勘其因，默点八门四理真。 口传此字长生诀，不须物外更求真。 阳日八门默点直日报应诗 若遇休门须掘土，更早悲喜定元因。 任你扁鹊也判死，徐公口口亲授真。 阴日八门默点直日报应诗 若遇惊门且过询，危险三日定元因。 更过景日徐公保，卢医扁鹊不度真。 跏趺口诀 日坐午夜坐子。 双飞七星罡，吹呵媾坎离。 婴儿姹女结，七七浴华池。 开七月、八月。 休九月、十月。 生十一月。 惊五月、六月居中。 伤十二月。 死三月辰、四月巳。 景二月卯。 杜正月寅。 右八门默点定直月报应例 逐月所值以取吉凶例 正月却以杜上行，景门且过二月旬。 辰巳更过四月节，惊门且过六月中。 开门定诀七月喜，九十牢记休上行。 生门又喜子月现，伤门定主过残年。 师入靖，念净口咒、净心咒、净身咒、净天地咒，炼秽讫存内，变诵延生经毕，师端坐跏趺，叩齿二十四通，交气。 贪巨禄文廉武破，□□□□□□□。 右斗，讳各交，念七遍，咽液九过，存己身，如本命真人状。 师默诵咒曰： 左青龙孟章速出吾左，嘘肝气一口於左畔。 右白虎监兵速出吾右，咽肺气一口於右畔。 前朱雀灵光速出吾前，呵心气於前。 后玄武执明速出吾后，吹肾气於后。 想四兽护呵法，身吹存两目，复出日月之光，谓之日月分光。 次存左右鼻吸入心结成真人在绛宫。 却念心咒 心中神，丹元君，号黄庭，字华婴，长二寸，广三分，着朱衣，系绛裙，秉威德，显圣灵，通造化，达至真，住心中，莫离身，凡有事，速报人。 急急如律令。 心步斗，入内服云车符，口授心传，方能尽矣。

**The *Inner Essentials of the Mysterious Eight Gates of Lord Deng Tianjun* (Sutra Title: *Inner Essentials of the Mysterious Eight Gates of Lord Deng Tianjun*)**
Attributed to an unknown author. One scroll.
Source: *The Orthodox Daoist Canon* (正统道藏), First Canon (正一部).

**Lord Deng Tianjun’s Inner Essentials of the Mysterious Eight Gates**
The Celestial Lord (天君) personally inscribed these Essentials of the Mysterious Eight Gates and the Secret Formula of the Sixty *Jiazi* (甲子) on the Palm.

Its essence is the formula for the Nine Palaces (九宫) and the Eight Gates (八门) to determine daily retributions (直日報應). The method of judgment differs from the *Eight Gates Drum Song* (打門槌歌) of the Divine Old Master Xu (徐神翁) and the *Ghost’s Knocks at the Gate* (鬼敲門) method; it is not based on candle divination (占灯) or ritual readings (占课).

Those who obtain this formula should not cling rigidly to its sequence but recite and memorize it well. Its auspicious or inauspicious meanings will be revealed by the Dao’s divine guidance (神告), infallible in every trial.

**First, refine the Two Attendants (二使) within the Dipper (斗).**
Then, draw the true forms of the Two Attendants and venerate them at dawn and dusk (晨夕寅奉).

**The Double-Flying Seven-Star Constraints (双飞七星罡):**
Exhale (吹) and inhale (呵) the *Kan* (坎) and *Li* (離) energies in union.
**The Infant and Maiden Formation (婴儿姹女结):**
The Two Attendants bathe in the *Hua Pool* (華池).

**Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth (金木水火土):**
Know their comings and goings, their births and deaths (去來知生死).
**Seize the Four Celestial Gates (四天門),**
No need to verify their efficacy (不問驗不驗).
**The Dipper’s Inner Vision (斗中内景):**
Silently recite the *Long Life Formula* (長生).

**The Secret Formula for Judging Auspiciousness in Poetry**
*"For mortals with ailments, examine their roots (勘其因),*
Silently recite the Eight Gates and Four Principles (四理) to reveal their truth (真).
*This oral transmission of the Long Life Formula (長生诀) requires no external means to seek its truth (不须物外更求真)."*

**The Auspicious Eight Gates Formula for Direct Daily Retribution (陽日八門默點直日報應詩)**
*"If the Gate of Auspiciousness (休門) is encountered, dig the soil (掘土) promptly,*
*Then early determine the causes of joy and sorrow (悲喜定元因).*
*Even Bian Que (扁鹊) himself may judge it as death,*
*But Master Xu’s words alone reveal its true essence (親授真)."*

**The Inauspicious Eight Gates Formula for Direct Daily Retribution (陰日八門默點直日報應詩)**
*"If the Gate of Alarm (驚門) appears, first cross the inquiry (過詢),*
*Danger looms for three days—its cause is fixed (定元因).*
*Beyond this, if the Gate of Auspiciousness (景門) is passed, Master Xu will safeguard (徐公保),*
*Yet neither Lu Yi (卢医) nor Bian Que (扁鹊) can cross its true boundary (不度真)."*

**The *Jiazi* (甲子) Formula for Auspiciousness (跏趺口诀)**
*"Sit in the morning, stand in the evening, and sit again at midnight (子).*
**Double-Flying Seven-Star Constraints (双飞七星罡):**
Exhale (吹) and inhale (呵) the *Kan* (坎) and *Li* (離) energies in union.
**The Infant and Maiden Formation (婴儿姹女结):**
The Seven Stars (七星) bathe in the *Hua Pool* (華池) for seventy-seven days.

*Open the gates in the seventh and eighth months (七月、八月).*
*Auspiciousness governs the ninth and tenth months (休九月、十月).*
*Life thrives in the eleventh month (生十一月).*
*Alarm dominates the fifth and sixth months (驚五月、六月居中).*
*Decay belongs to the twelfth month (傷十二月).*
*Death is fixed in the third month’s *Chen* (辰) and fourth month’s *Si* (巳) (死三月辰、四月巳).*
*The Gate of Auspiciousness (景門) passes through the second month’s *Mao* (卯).*
*Du (杜) governs the first month’s *Yin* (寅)."*

**The Right Eight Gates Formula for Determining Auspiciousness by Month (逐月所值以取吉凶例)**
*"The monthly correspondences are taken thus for auspicious or inauspicious signs:*
*In the first month, reverse the Du (杜) gate to ascend (上行).*
*The Gate of Auspiciousness (景門) passes through the second month’s decan (旬).*
*Chen (辰) and Si (巳) cross the fourth month’s node (節).*
*The Gate of Alarm (驚門) passes through the sixth month’s midpoint (中).*
*The Gate of Opening (開門) determines joy in the seventh month (七月喜),*
*Memorize firmly: Auspiciousness ascends in the ninth month (九十牢記休上行).*
*The Gate of Life (生門) again brings joy when the *Zi* (子) month appears (子月現).*
*The Gate of Decay (傷門) determines the master’s fate in the passing year (過残年)."*

**The Ritual Process**
The master enters a state of tranquility (靖), reciting the *Pure Mouth Incantation* (念净口咒), the *Pure Heart Incantation* (净心咒), the *Pure Body Incantation* (净身咒), and the *Pure Heaven and Earth Incantation* (净天地咒). After refining impurities (炼秽), the *qi* is retained within (存内), the *Yan Sheng Scripture* (延生经) is recited in transformation (变诵), and the master sits in *Dali* (跏趺) posture, striking teeth twenty-four times (叩齿二十四通), and harmonizing breath (交气).

*"Greed for vast wealth (贪巨禄) and corruption in virtue (文廉武破) [are judged],*
*[Blank] [Blank] [Blank] [Blank] [Blank] [Blank] [Blank]."*

**The Dipper (斗) Ritual**
Each participant (讳各交) recites seven times (七遍), swallowing saliva nine times (咽液九过), retaining the *qi* within oneself as the True Person of one’s natal command (本命真人状).

**The Master’s Silent Incantation (師默诵咒曰):**
*"The Left Azure Dragon (左青龙), Master Meng (孟章), swiftly emerges from my left,*
*Exhale the liver *qi* (嘘肝气) once into the left side.*
*The Right White Tiger (右白虎), Marshal Jing (监兵), swiftly emerges from my right,*
*Inhale the lung *qi* (咽肺气) once into the right side.*
*The Front Vermilion Bird (前朱雀), Spirit Guang (灵光), swiftly emerges before me,*
*Exhale the heart *qi* (呵心气) before me.*
*The Rear Dark Tortoise (后玄武), Bearer of Brilliance (执明), swiftly emerges behind me,*
*Inhale the kidney *qi* (吹肾气) behind me.*
*Imagine the Four Beasts (四兽) guarding the exhalation-inhalation method (护呵法),*
*Retain the *qi* within the body, blowing it into both eyes (身吹存两目),*
*Then manifest the light of sun and moon (日月之光),*
*Called the *Division of Sun and Moon Light* (日月分光).*
*Next, store the *qi* in the left and right nostrils, inhaling it into the heart,*
*Forming the True Person (真人) within the Vermilion Palace (绛宫)."*

**Then recite the Heart Incantation (却念心咒):**
*"Heart’s divine spirit (心中神),*
*Lord Dan Yuan (丹元君),*
*Named Huang Ting (黄庭),*
*Called Hua Yin (字华婴),*
*Two inches in length (长二寸),*
*Three *fen* in breadth (广三分),*
*Wearing crimson robes (着朱衣),*
*With vermilion sash (系绛裙),*
*Wielding awe-inspiring virtue (秉威德),*
*Manifesting sacred brilliance (显圣灵),*
*Penetrating creation (通造化),*
*Reaching ultimate truth (达至真),*
*Dwelling in the heart (住心中),*
*Never leaving the body (莫离身),*
*In all affairs, swiftly reporting to mortals (凡有事，速报人).*
*Urgent, as the precepts decree (急急如律令)."*

**The Heart’s Path in the Dipper (心步斗),**
*Entering to serve the Cloud Chariot Talisman (入内服云车符),*
*Oral transmission and heart transmission (口授心传) alone suffice (方能尽矣).*

**"The Thousand-Gold Secret—Oath and Transmission"**

*Never reveal this treasure—*
*Memorize the sworn vow.*
*When the Cloud Chariot suddenly arrives,*
*Store the reverent Fire Officials and attendants—*
*The qi of the five viscera condensed within.*
*Next, ascend the Cloud Chariot,*
*With the beloved attendants and certain generals following,*
*The Four Rectifiers riding in procession,*
*Passing through the Yellow Path’s climatic zones.*
*Rise as if scaling the void,*
*Drawing upon the *wāifēng* qi—*
*The membrane.*
*If the wind turns grim and uncrossable,*
*Suddenly the reverent Fire appears—*
*The *dǎnshén* (bodiless spirit).*
*Fan aside the *wāifēng*,*
*The Yellow Path now clear.*
*Suddenly, the Rainbow Bridge approaches—*
*The generals emerge from the Cloud Chariot,*
*With the reverent Fire and Four Rectifiers,*
*Crossing into the Hall of Audience.*
*The Four Rectifiers present Yang Yan and Geng Bi,*
*Who lead me into the *Xuánjī* Bureau,*
*To pay homage and report.*
*Afterward, with the Four Rectifiers and the *dǎnshén*,*
*We exit the Hall,*
*Observing any omens returned.*
*If no response comes to the petitions,*
*Retire into the *Jìng* Chamber,*
*Wait for verification,*
*Then return with the beloved attendants, the *dǎnshén*,*
*And the Four Rectifiers,*
*Descend the Bridge, board the Cloud Chariot,*
*Pass through the Yellow Path’s *gāngfēng* winds,*
*Arrive at the Vermilion Palace,*
*Disembark, and reintegrate the attendants into the body.*
*Swallow saliva, strike the teeth,*
*Then proceed according to the prescribed method,*
*Returning each to its proper domain.*
*Suddenly, the form vanishes—*
*The *Nine Palaces, Eight Gates* Omen Chart.*

**Sun Shock, Moon Rest:**
*When *jiǎzǐ* (the first heavenly stem-branch) arrives at the Central Palace,*
*It is the *Kūn* Earth Gate.*
*The remaining sixty *jiǎzǐ* follow in cycles.*
*The Yellow Nine Palaces:*
*Each day governs one position,*
*Cycling endlessly.*
*On days matching the native *yin* day,*
*Rest on *yang* days—*
*The preceding position opens the Palace.*
*According to the Nine Palaces’ *jiǎzǐ*,*
*From *yǐ* to *dīng*, the evasions rise—*
*Most verified.*
*This must remain supremely secret.*
*If later disciples receive this,*
*Never reveal it lightly—*
*Disaster will fall upon the Nine Ancestors,*
*The Bridge, and your wife’s lineage.*

---

**The Longevity Wheel and Dipper Rotation:**

*If born on *jiǎzǐ*,*
*Metal’s *chángshēng* reaches *wèi*.*
*Thus begins the pattern—*
*Child is *Pòjūn* (the Broken Army),*
*Single-marching to its native month,*
*Then retreating—*
*Determining auspicious or inauspicious months.*
*Count *chángshēng* to the fetal stage,*
*Then add *xiū*, *yōu*, *sǐ*, and *jué*—*
*Predicting misfortune for the ill,*
*Which month they reside in,*
*To know life, death, and fortune.*
*Again, take the hour—*
*For example, *wǔ* (Fire)—*
*Fire’s *chángshēng* reaches *yín*.*
*As before,*
*Count forward to determine the direct influence,*
*Add the native day,*
*Then cross-check which day aligns with the native *wǔ*—*
*Thus, life, death, and fortune are known.*

*Oral transmission exhausts here—*
*Only the enlightened can comprehend.*

**The Monthly Dipper Rotation Pattern:**

*First month: *yín* (Tiger),*
*Second: *mǎo* (Rabbit),*
*Third: *chén* (Dragon),*
*Fourth: *sì* (Snake),*

*Metal’s *chángshēng* reaches *wèi*,*
*Wood’s to *hài*,*
*Water and Earth’s *chángshēng* dwell in *shēn*,*
*Fire’s to *yín*.*
*According to the Dipper’s domain,*
*The zodiac’s pattern is as written above.*
*Count *chángshēng*, *mùyù*, *guàn dài*, *lín guān*, *dì wàng*,*
*Rest, imprisonment, death, and absolute void,*
*Then add *xiū*, *yōu*, *sǐ*, *jué*—*
*For the afflicted, which month they were born,*
*To know fortune or misfortune.*

*Tested a thousand times—*
*Thousandfold verified,*
*The master’s transmission never errs,*
*Only the disciple’s blame.*
*The gods will not respond.*

*Knock, knock—*
*Never lightly divulge these mysteries.*

*Called *Dǎménchuí* (Striking the Gate),*
*Also *Guǐ Qiǎo Mén* (Ghost Knocking at the Gate).*

*Is the ghostly spirit’s report.*

*The intervening omens of rest or calamity.*

*Fortune is known.*

*Disaster follows.*

*Adultery and scandal will follow.*

*The sick will die without medicine.*

*Weigh the light and heavy,*

*Someone will depart.*

*Wealth will scatter, and thieves will prey.*

*Fields will be ruined,*
*Broken vessels foretell misfortune.*

*Unsettled.*

*On *yang* days in the *Zhèn* position,*

*On *yin* days in the *xiǎo fáng*,*
*Girls arrive.*

*The Five Bandits rage.*
*If cats mew,*
*Debts and grievances will follow.*
*If cats bite the feet,*
*The *Tánshén* (Incense Spirit) brings calamity—*
*Offerings must be made.*

*Fortune or misfortune—*
*If blooming, do not rejoice prematurely.*
*Oxen, sheep, or dogs are never auspicious,*
*Curses, roosters crowing, or the *Zhūquè* (Vermilion Bird) cries.*

*A girl will be born.*

This is the true *口诀* (oral formula) of Xu Shenwang,

能交世俗善通神。」
capable of harmonizing with mortals and effectively communicating with deities.

「学取自知如至宝，
To learn and master this is akin to discovering a supreme treasure;

千金莫泄与非人。」
do not reveal it for a thousand gold—never to the unworthy.

「留传末后参详到，
Pass it down to future generations for careful study;

管取虚无一寸金。」
for even an inch of gold is worthless compared to its wisdom.

「又名煞
Also known as *煞* (ill-fated days):

年逢生煞日凶亡，
If one’s birth year encounters an ill-fated day, disaster or death befalls;

一死一生也难当。」
even one death or one life may not suffice to endure its consequences.

「若遇吉时并凶日，
If auspicious times coincide with ill-fated days,

也须奏告保安康。」
one must still perform rites to ensure safety and longevity.

「坤生、兑、死乾、离危、起吉坎、巽安、震、凶艮。」
*坤* (Earth) births, *兑* (Joy) births, *乾* (Heaven) dies, *离* (Fire) is perilous, *坎* (Abyss) is auspicious, *巽* (Wind) brings tranquility, *震* (Thunder) is ill-fated, and *艮* (Mountain) is ill-fated.

「论是何生得几岁，
To calculate how many years one will live based on their birth:

却从坎上起数一十，
begin counting from *坎* (Abyss) upward by ten;

艮上二十，
from *艮* (Mountain) upward by twenty—

零数节节数去，
discarding remainders at each step,

直何年上遁月，
until reaching the year of escape by month,

月上遁日，
by day within the month,

日上遁时，
by hour within the day,

直何吉凶，
to determine the ultimate auspiciousness or ill-fate.

以验祸福。」
This verifies fortune or misfortune.

「论一年月分，
To calculate for a single year and month:

却将正月从艮上，
begin with the first month from *艮* (Mountain);

二月震，
the second month from *震* (Thunder);

三月、四月巽，
the third and fourth months from *巽* (Wind);

五月、六月离，
the fifth and sixth months from *离* (Fire);

七月、八月坤，
the seventh and eighth months from *坤* (Earth);

九月、十月兑，
the ninth and tenth months from *兑* (Joy);

十一月乾，
the eleventh month from *乾* (Heaven);

十二月坎。」
the twelfth month from *坎* (Abyss).

「若论日子吉凶，
If one calculates the auspiciousness or ill-fate of days:

从乾上起子，
begin with *乾* (Heaven) for the day’s stem,

顺行节节数去，
counting sequentially through the branches,

以诀吉凶。」
to determine their auspiciousness or ill-fate.

「八门硬例
The *八门* (Eight Doors) fixed rules:

假如，甲子日属阳顺，
For instance, if the *甲子* (first day of the sexagenary cycle) belongs to *阳顺* (auspicious *yang*),

从乾上起杜、景、死、惊、开、休、生、伤。」
count from *乾* (Heaven) as follows: *杜* (blocked), *景* (bright), *死* (death), *惊* (fright), *开* (open), *休* (rest), *生* (life), and *伤* (injury).

「假如乙丑日属阴，
If the *乙丑* (second day) belongs to *阴* (yin),

逆行从艮上起杜、景、死、惊、开、休、生、伤。」
count in reverse from *艮* (Mountain): *杜* (blocked), *景* (bright), *死* (death), *惊* (fright), *开* (open), *休* (rest), *生* (life), and *伤* (injury).

余仿此，
The rest follow similarly,

年月日时，
for years, months, days, and hours,

皆论阴阳日建立八门俱仿此例。」
each must be calculated according to *yin-yang* and the day’s stem, following this rule.

「报应吉凶，
The consequences of auspiciousness or ill-fate

在於七内。」
lie within the *七内* (seven internal factors).

「家人立杜还天愿，
If household members set up *杜* (blocked), it fulfills Heaven’s wishes;

外人到杜遭天谴。」
while outsiders encountering *杜* face Heaven’s punishment.

「猫至冤牵天愿催，
If cats arrive, they hasten grievances tied to Heaven’s wishes;

叫凶静吉可禳转。」
while their cries indicate ill-fate, which may be averted by tranquility and auspiciousness.

「大来咒诅灵泽坛，
If great curses or invocations come,

吠主哭声三七见。」
the master’s barking or weeping will appear on the third or seventh day.

「景户兄声人财离，
If *景* (bright) coincides with a brother’s voice,

猫叫冤愆白虎随。」
while a cat’s cry indicates grievances, with the *白虎* (White Tiger) following.

「三七之中主哭泣，
On the third or seventh day, the master weeps;

屋漏之时讼解归。」
while leaks in the house during litigation bring resolution.

「蛛子垂丝应落地，
If a spider descends its thread to the ground,

婚姻喜事两相宜。」
it signifies auspiciousness for both marriage and joyous affairs.

「死户猫声病主亡，
If *死* (death) coincides with a cat’s cry,

犬来逐鼠病狼当。」
while dogs chasing mice indicate that the master’s illness will be as dire as a wolf’s.

「响应之时灯寿灭，
If the *响应* (echo) coincides with the time,

灯寿灭。」
the lamp’s lifespan will be extinguished.

「三朝一七主离床，
On the third day or seventh day of an illness,

儿童叫时悲哭动，
if children cry out in sorrow,

此方宜静且审详。」
this situation demands calm and careful scrutiny.

「惊户外人喧主殃，
If *惊* (fright) coincides with outsiders’ noise,

猫犬高声且见凶。」
while cats or dogs barking loudly indicate ill-fate.

「孕妇定然主惊恐，
If a pregnant woman is alarmed,

器破之时大不同。」
while broken vessels at that time signify great differences.

「开烛猫犬大吉祥，
If *开* (open) coincides with cats or dogs,

鼠静财凶后主昌。」
while mice being tranquil indicate that financial ill-fate will later bring prosperity.

「风雨病迟讼即解，
If wind or rain coincide with delayed illness,

蛛子垂丝百事昌。」
while spiders descending their threads signify auspiciousness for all matters.

「休门屋漏主更移，
If *休* (rest) coincides with a leaky house,

讼中得理病人奇。」
while litigants gain justice, the sick person faces extraordinary circumstances.

「二物叫时醮谢吉，
If two creatures cry out during a *醮* (exorcism) ritual,

风中司命亦相欺。」
while the *司命* (Deity of Life) in the wind may also deceive.

「蛛子垂丝内外喜，
If spiders descend their threads,

看看有梦吋熊熊。」
one must observe carefully, as auspicious dreams will blaze forth.

「生门垂蛛孕生女，
If *生* (life) coincides with spiders descending,

一米阳产两成坤。」
one *米* (measure) of *yang* (male) production will yield two *坤* (female) results.

「猫犬去时凶得吉，
If cats or dogs depart at an ill-fated time,

家先司命保元亨。」
while ancestral *司命* (Deities of Life) safeguard the primal prosperity.

「伤门猫犬去时吉，
If *伤* (injury) coincides with cats or dogs departing,

高座喧争大不然。」
while high seats bring noisy disputes, which are most inauspicious.

「外客高声猖鬼乱，
If outsiders speak loudly,

啾嘈鼠子主喧争。」
while mice chattering indicate the master will face disputes.

「自己察情兆
One must examine personal omens:

闲坐最为吉，
sitting leisurely is most auspicious;

高枕主留连。」
while reclining with a high pillow indicates lingering attachment.

「切忌持刀斧，
One must strictly avoid holding axes or knives;

锄铺主穷年。」
while hoeing or plowing portends a year of poverty.

「自己有呻吟，
If one groans or moans to oneself,

安能保别人。」
how can one protect others?

「手弹时气病，
If one plays with *时气* (auspicious timing) by hand,

争斗一朝临。」
litigation or conflict will soon arise.

「看经却主吉，
If one reads scriptures,

病愈在一七。」
illness will recover on the seventh day.

「治事终迟滞，
If one delays in attending to matters,

终须宽裹急。」
one must eventually broaden and then narrow the approach.

「恰直起时病，
If illness arises at the exact moment of uprightness,

安在三两日。」
it will not last beyond three days.

「若直欢娱时，
If illness arises during a time of joy and merriment,

病者愈为奇。」
the sick person’s recovery will be miraculous.

「若直忧立时，
If illness arises during a time of sorrow and distress,

病者见倾危。」
the sick person faces imminent peril.

「若言吉财吉，
If one speaks of auspicious fortune,

若言凶则凶。」
while if one speaks of ill-fate, ill-fate will prevail.

「来人气象好，
If visitors appear with a favorable *气象* (aura),

祸福不相同。」
fortune and misfortune will not be the same.

「我身无事阻，
If my own body faces no obstruction,

即往运亨通。」
then all endeavors will proceed smoothly and auspiciously.

「The hunched back and staff arrive—
the sick will die without need for medicine.

A raincoat and straw hat come to greet—
the mourning garments loom, pressing with urgency.

When parasols summon me back and forth,
the seven-day mourning may be granted leniency.

If the person wears coarse hemp,
the mourning attire is prepared in due course.

A headcloth and cap strengthen the body—
the sick will soon regain health.

At this time, if one tastes food or drink,
wealth and horses will not be severed.

If one drinks early spring tea,
its refreshing coolness proves most beneficial.

If one consumes all manner of fruits,
boils and abscesses will worsen daily.

If the epidemic does not harm,
chronic illness resists medicine’s calming.

On the road, if no obstacles are met,
the aged will return with the vigor of youth.

If one encounters others’ entreaties first,
the illness lingers, delayed in its answer.

When I return home with uprightness,
stars and constellations emerge from the clouds.

If I speak with others in anger,
the sick will face *迍否* (obstruction and misfortune).

When called during times of joy and celebration,
morning sickness vanishes by nightfall.

After clear skies in spring or winter,
the *晦滞* (obscured and stagnant) will multiply with rain.

After clear skies in summer or autumn,
no medicine is needed—the illness will heal.

When called, observe their demeanor—
cleverness lies in the mind’s keen insight.

Another method for predicting one’s return:
Do not rely solely on the time—use the mouth as reference.

For instance, if *子时* (midnight) is given,
*子* belongs to Water—Water and Earth flourish at midnight.

Using this as precedent,
compare it to the *长生斗* (Celestial Longevity Measure),
and proceed through each node in rotation.

If one meets *子* (Water) in its ascendancy,
it is indeed flourishing.

The person will surely return on *子丑* (midnight to 1–3 AM) days.
If *养* (Nourishing) is encountered, they will return as well.

The rest follow this pattern analogously.

Fear not the black wind or towering waves—
the ship’s journey depends entirely on the helmsman’s skill.

*—Chao Yuan An* (□) *—(□) Om—*

Tread the iron shoes until no trace remains,
yet seek not—it comes effortlessly.
*—Hūm—* Leaf and branch unite.»

**Secret Appendix:**

Above the kidneys, below the heart—
to the west of the liver, to the left of the lungs—
this is the **Divine Brightness Acupoint**,
within which lie the **Kàn-Lí Palaces** [1].

With the tongue’s tip, inscribe:
*"Óng"*—when the character moves, *"Hūm"*—
emerging from the **Kàn and Lí hexagrams**.

The Dragon issues forth from fire’s embrace,
the Tiger is born within the water’s depths.

The **Nine Palaces, Eight Gates** elusion method
must be mastered through the sixty **Tiān-Gān-Dì-Zǐ** [2] cycles.

Inscribe the talisman:
Left at **Heaven’s Pass (Tiān Guān)**,
right at **Earth’s Axis (Dì Zhóu)**,
preserving the self as the **Mysterious Sovereign**,
with the tortoise and serpent standing above.

With the **orifices** drawing in water and fire into the talisman,
take the **iron armor’s silver radiance** into it,
then draw in the **gallbladder’s essence**,
mixing with *"Zhuàng"* and *"Óng"*—
depending on the method, issue forth.

The **Mysterious Soul’s Eight Gates** secret—
rarely revealed, worth a thousand gold—
do not divulge.

Practice long, and one may **enter the Dao**;
employ it long, and one may **communicate with spirits**.

Most secret, most secret—
revere this method.

Revealing it to the unworthy
brings calamity to the nine ancestral lines,
a grave misfortune—
be exceedingly cautious.

Blood-slave, flesh-slave, you are the **compassionate true parents**.

The **Tiān Péng Curse** forms the **Wēn Shuài’s** original self-symbol.
The talisman invokes the **Earthly Deities’ Marshal Wēn**,
conjuring the **Six Tiān-Gān Generals**—**Nǐ Dān Sòng**—
commanding the **Supervising Officials of Fate and Land Spirits**,
to safeguard the child,
whereby the affliction of **nightly crying** shall cease—
the talisman’s arrival shall swiftly resolve it.
Upon its arrival, execute as commanded.

**Subject** [name redacted], having received the **Imperial Edict**,
shall carry out this decree.

*—By the decree of the **Heavenly Lord of Mysterious Soul’s Eight Gates Retribution**—*
**Final.**
